title: Urban Wind Mitigation in San Carlos de Bariloche
text: In Bariloche, the prevailing Patagonian winds create high-shear zones in the city center. This project explores how urban vegetation can be strategically placed to mitigate wind erosion.

title: Urban Wind Mitigation in San Carlos de Bariloche
text: In Bariloche, the prevailing Patagonian winds create high-shear zones in the city center. This project explores how urban vegetation can be strategically placed to mitigate wind erosion.

title: Urban Wind Mitigation in San Carlos de Bariloche
text:
Simulation Framework
To capture the complexity of the urban terrain, I utilized: * Solver: simpleFoam for steady-state incompressible flow. * Meshing: snappyHexMesh refined around building edges. * Porosity: Trees were modeled as porous zones with Darcy-Forchheimer coefficients.

title: Urban Wind Mitigation in San Carlos de Bariloche
text:
Discussion
The simulation suggests that a 15% increase in porous barriers leads to a 25% reduction in pedestrian-level wind speeds in the target zones.
